SENT.plain: Endoscopy plays an important role in the diagnosis and management of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD)
It is useful to exclude other aetiologies, differentiate between ulcerative colitis (UC) and Crohn's disease (CD), and define the extent and activity of inflammation
Ileocolonoscopy is used for monitoring of the disease, which in turn helps to optimize the management
It plays a key role in the surveillance of UC for dysplasia or neoplasia and assessment of post operative CD
Capsule endoscopy and double balloon enteroscopy are increasingly used in patients with CD
Therapeutic applications relate to stricture dilatation and dysplasia resection
The endoscopist's role is vital in the overall management of IBD
